item.title: 01 DMIR
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: 02 GDUT
item.description: Eureka supports the rendering of diagrams by using Mermaid.

item.title: Acknowledgements
item.description: My deepest debt is owed to my family for their invariant understanding and support. To my parents, Yipeng Chen (陈轶鹏) and Chuhua Lin (林春华), for their endless love and tolerance. They are the great parents who always left with the best for me, playing their crucial role in together paving the way for my future. I would like to say to them my inner love, and I incomparably treasure the time when I can still be with them in their rest of lives.

item.title: Blogs (on Chinese)
item.description: Since a repetition of the same life from its beginning is not to be expected, the next thing most like living one’s life over again seems to be a recollection of that life, and to make that recollection as durable as possible by putting it down in writing. But this may be read or not as any one pleases. I desire with all humility to acknowledge that, in fact, I owe the happiness of my past life to the kind providence of God.

item.title: Experience & News
item.description: Mar. 2024 - Note: I am mainly preparing for the TOFEL and GRE test during these period; I am also looking for reaching out internships (> 6 months) about computational neuroscience from this summer (upon my graduation). Aug. 2023 - Mar. 2024 After I left the DMIR lab, I spent time in writing a “special paper” on the topic of how to learn the causal diagram, also as a summary for my research experience on “causal discovery” over the last two years.

item.title: Math Support
item.description: Eureka supports the rendering of mathematical formulas by using KaTeX.

item.title: Work
item.description: Projects Introduction Aug. 2023 – Mar. 2024 A Primer on Causal Diagram Learning (Work for Popularization of Science and Technology) For details, also see the article ‘A Primer on Causal Diagram Learning: Interpreting Causation from the Causal Discovery Perspective’ in Papers.2024 on this page. Since I was motivated by fundamental ideas of causality from a popular science book named ‘The Book of WHY’, I attempt to further create connections in the book to other celebrated books by leaders in causation, centering around subjects of “causal diagram learning”.
